txt.en: 'Andiriniel! Wait! I am here!'
'Please wait! I am sorry, I... I wasn't thinking clearly. I should have come sooner.'
Andiriniel opens the letter and reads its contents, an expression of anger stealing across her face as she finishes the missive.
'Please let me make amends my love! You know how hard this sort of thing is for me...'
'No, I... I suppose you would not.'
'How dare he?! It has been over twenty years since I have been able to make the journey from Rivendell, and he has the gall to send a messenger in his stead!?'
'As you wish, my dear Andiriniel.'
'I shall send him a message that he will not soon forget!'
'Oh really? Is that what you think?'
'Perhaps after three hundred years I have come to prefer the distance afforded by an impersonal letter delivered by a complete stranger!'
Hadhelen has written a letter to Andiriniel, whom he was supposed to meet at the Lady's Rest.
'Oh get up, Hadhelen. If I did not truly love you, I would hardly take the time to berate you for your absurd behaviour, now would I?'
'Come then my foolish Elf, and let us discuss your shortcomings in some more private setting, shall we?'

'Perchance could you do me a discreet favour, [placeholder]. There is a woman I was supposed to meet by the Lady's Rest, just a short ways south-west of the gates of Caras Galadhon, but I do not think I will be able to make it. I was hoping you could take this letter to her for me.

'Please forgive me for pressing this upon you... I would never do so were the situation not so urgent!

'I... I have work to do now....'
Andiriniel is at the Lady's Rest, south-west of the gates of Caras Galadhon.\n\nHadhelen asked you to deliver his letter to Andiriniel.
'What is this? A letter for me? I was not expecting anything of the sort.\n\n'Very well, let me see what this mysterious message is about....'
'Have you delivered my letter to Andiriniel yet? Please do hurry.'
'YOU SHOULDN'T EVER SEE THIS TEXT'
Deliver the sealed letter to Andiriniel at the Lady's Rest
The Fool's Letter
